body_html: @yupbank multi_label_head is for problems where the number of labels is not fixed. So it makes sense to have SparseTensor. Do you have a problem with a fixed number of labels n>1? Then one option is to split each each example into n examples and use multi_class_label.
body_text: @yupbank multi_label_head is for problems where the number of labels is not fixed. So it makes sense to have SparseTensor. Do you have a problem with a fixed number of labels n>1? Then one option is to split each each example into n examples and use multi_class_label.
body: @yupbank `multi_label_head` is for problems where the number of labels is not fixed. So it makes sense to have `SparseTensor`. Do you have a problem with a fixed number of labels `n>1`? Then one option is to split each each example into `n` examples and use `multi_class_label`.
